subject: PS
title: Government, Politics and the Public Service
description: Public servants require a thorough understanding of Canada's political system.  This course examines the structure and functions of the Westminster system of government, upon which Canada's is based, and explores the role of the public service in relation to other fundamental institutions of Canadian governance, such as the political executive, the legislature and the judiciary.  Topics examined include the unique context of Canadian politics and public administration, the role of the federal, provincial and municipal levels of government within the Canadian federation, ministerial responsibility and accountability, and contemporary challenges facing the public service.  This course is restricted to students enrolled in the Master of Public Service program.
